attacked lasting several hours dozens of

town last night as local people watched
the World Cup on TV at the breeze view

to watch as they killed the men revenge
they said for the actions of Kenyan
troops in neighboring Somalia inevitably
the authorities are blaming Somalia's
al-shabaab but the group does not appear
to have claimed responsibility the
victims were all locals and Becky Toni
is not a tourist haunt but banks and
government buildings were also set
alight shooting was heard late into the

some residents fled into nearby forests
to escape the carnage so far the bodies
which have managed to collect on the

troops arrived to secure the area
the authorities have said they'll be on
high alert throughout the World Cup and
that public viewings of games will be
kept safe four years ago al-shabaab
attacked World Cup fans in the Ugandan
capital Kampala more than 70 people were
killed in - near simultaneous bombings
and if the latest violence is the work
of al-shabaab it'll be the group's most
audacious operation since the attack on
Nairobi's Westgate shopping mall last
September the Kenyan Red Cross has
arrived in impecca Tony helping to track
down survivors and assess the aftermath
of this devastating attack Paul Adams
BBC news
